pros:
- There was COVID pay early in the pandemic
- Tuition Assistance ($150/month)
cons:
- Poor communication with discipline leaders or managers
- Meager salary increase each year (I don't think HCA was giving any raise in 2022, and in the past, the "raise" did not even keep up with inflation)
- Managers and higher ups just push for more, more more, yet, you never see these "leaders" in the trenches with their staff. Makes it very difficult to want to follow this "leader"
- The hospital profits millions of dollars a year, but cannot pay competitive rates to the people who are actually working hard

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Pulaski, VA
pros: Competitive pay for the area and decent benefits.
cons: It’s a small town hospital in southwestern Virginia and you will be discriminated against and targeted if you’re not white. If you report such incidents, they will not be taken seriously because upper management and corporate are all white. Basically, don’t work here if you’re a person of color. I read similar reviews before I started working here, and I didn’t listen. I wish I had.

pros: Great people, free staff parking
cons: Low PTO accrual, No paid holidays off,

pros: Caring management and friendly department
cons: Lots of call, low pay

pros: 401k match and student loan repayment (benefits)
cons: Upper management, nursing staff can use improvement

pros: Good place, enjoy the people
cons: Slow lab, understaffed, schedule changes

pros: Pay is good, but not feeling like it's worth it
cons: No support as a new grad, feel like they're just rushing me into taking my own group without actually teaching me

pros: I dont know of any
cons: Pay is too low for nurses

pros: Paid classroom orientation for new graduates
cons: Abusive coworkers, toxic culture, unresponsive middle management. I was hired as a new graduate nurse and was so excited to start out as a nurse. I almost quit nursing immediately. I was paired with cruel, short tempered preceptors who would bully new grads intentionally. One preceptor told me I was doing a terrible job and did everything in her power to get me fired before I was even off of orientation. Instead of placing me with a new, supportive preceptor, my manager told me he didn't think I had critical thinking skills and that I needed to prove myself or get out. All of the experienced nurses end up leaving because they won't tolerate the short staffing and toxic culture of this hospital, which is why they hire huge amounts of new grads every year. Almost all of the new grads I started with in 2019 have quit a year later. New grads- beware! You will not get the support you need to become a great nurse in this abusive hospital.

job_title: Armed Security Officer in Roanoke, VA
pros:
Training Opportunities abound
Proactive Scheduling in that you can plan a life outside of work. Schedules are done 30 days in advance.
Competitive pay scale.
cons:
Elements above local management level (HCA Corporate) are not familiar with core competencies needed for security/law enforcement operations.
Logistical and Operational support from
HCA is lacking.  HR is incapable of posting positions in a timely manner or accelerating hiring process when department is critically short staffed.
High Turnover rate at Senior Management Level is a cause for concern... Disrupts operations and continuity for long term strategic vision of department's structure, goals, and mission.

review_title: They pay nurses better than the other guy
pros: They have a better market pay scale for nurses. The other guy I hear oays their nurses very bad and I wonder if thats why we get a lot of the ABSN students from Jefferson. They are the most sought after and lewis gale does lat well. Good team work environment as well. I like my manager.
cons: Sometimes problems are not resolved as fast as we would like them to be solved, but I understand it takes time to improve things. The marketing could also be a bit better as well to attract nurses even more than we already do.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Blacksburg, VA
pros:
Pay is better for a VA hospital then some others I’ve worked
Team work among the nurses I worked with has always been great
Self scheduling
cons:
Fragmented communication between departments and management 
Lack of quality control over physicians that are employed- they do whatever they want even if it’s not the most up to date practice or questionable practice
Meditech documentation system is old and awful!!!
